boat.name: Turtle
boat.full_description: Turtle. I originally tried to purchase Turtle in 1986 but my offer was rejected, in 2002 I came across her laying a wreck at Leigh on sea and bought her for £30\. Due to her construction with vertical iron nails there was no option but to sheath her in GRP which has proved a great success, 2007 new decks, 2018 new sails by James Lawrence, 2020 new bulkhead and “yachty” refit. Turtle was rumoured to have been built in North America as a farm or smallholding boat and was obviously designed to carry weight, eg sheep, pigs or hay etc . Cheaply built and not expected to last more than a few years. Locals say she was shipped to Tilbury dock on a Liberty ship just after WW2\. She was owned in the 50s & 60s by the Leigh on Sea marine artist Vic Ellis and was moored by the Essex Yacht Club. She has now been saved for many years of happy sailing.
boat.short_description: Turtle is a heavy half deck day boat, built with a solid rock elm bottom board with strip planks iron nailed vertically, probably not expected to last more than a few years. she has now been sheathed with GRP. local rumour is that she was a farm boat shipped to Tilbury dock from North America just after WW2, she was owned by the marine artist Vic Ellis for many years
